page.title: 16IVEGILL CofE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
The primary school in Ivegill was built in 1873. An extension was built onto it in 1965. There are records of formal teaching in the parish from as far back as the early 17th Century.
With working space for 65 children, in 1974 the roll totalled 54. This number remained level until 1979 at 49, then dropped in 1980 to 37. Since that date the number has declined to the present roll of 20. It is projected that this number will slowly increase over the coming years - for example, in the next school year (85-86) the number on roll will be 23.
